tasmax.comment: maximum from all integrated time steps per day

tasmin.comment: minimum from all integrated time steps per day

tsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tsl.comment: Temperature of each soil layer (3D variable). Reported as missing for grid cells with no land.

prhmax.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within hours time: maximum over hours
prhmax.comment: Defined as maximum of the precipitation rate averaged over the whole hour.

prsn.comment: At surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

mrros.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

mrro.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

snm.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

sfcWindmax.comment: Maximum from all integrated time steps per day

sund.comment: The WMO definition of sunshine is that the surface incident radiative flux from the solar beam (i.e. excluding diffuse skylight) exceeds 120 W m-2. "Duration" is the length of time for which a condition holds.

mrfso.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrfso.comment: The mass of frozen water per unit area, summed over all soil layers. Reported as missing for grid cells with no land.

mrfsos.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrfsos.long_name: Frozen Water Content in Upper Portion of Soil Column
mrfsos.comment: The mass of frosen water in the upper 10cm of the soil layer. Reported as missing for grid cells with no land. (not in CMIP)

mrsfl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsfl.long_name: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer
mrsfl.comment: The mass of frosen water in each soil layer (3D variable). Reported as missing for grid cells with no land. (not in CMIP) [mrfsol -> mrsfl, 2022.09.22, https://github.com/WCRP-CORDEX/cordex-cmip6-data-request/issues/2 ]

mrso.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrso.comment: The mass of water in all phases per unit area, summed over all soil layers.

mrsos.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsos.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
mrsos.comment: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the soil layer. Reported as missing for grid cells with no land.

mrsol.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsol.long_name: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
mrsol.comment: The mass of water in all phases in each soil layer (3D variable). Reported as missing for grid cells with no land.

snw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

snd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

siconca.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice

evspsblpot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

wsgsmax.long_name: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Wind Speed of Gust

capemax.long_name: Daily Maximum Convective Available Potential Energy

zos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zos.comment: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.

tos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tos.comment: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.

sos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sos.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

mlotst.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mlotst.long_name: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
mlotst.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

thetao.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
thetao.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

hfds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfds.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
hfds.comment: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment') .

hfcorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfcorr.comment: Flux correction is also called 'flux adjustment'. A positive flux correction is downward i.e. added to the ocean. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

rsntds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
rsntds.long_name: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
rsntds.comment: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.

tauuo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tauuo.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
tauuo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

tauvo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tauvo.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
tauvo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

uos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

vos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

wfo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfo.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum *wfonocorr* and *wfcorr*.

friver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
friver.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
friver.comment: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

wfonocorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfonocorr.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water Without Flux Correction
wfonocorr.comment: Computed as the water flux (without flux correction) into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

so.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
so.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

uo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
uo.comment: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

vo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vo.comment: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

wo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wo.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward).

rhop.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

difvho.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

tob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tob.long_name: Sea Water Potential Temperature at Sea Floor
tob.comment: Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.

siconc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
siconc.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice

sithick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sithick.comment: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice (NOT volume divided by grid area as was done in CMIP5)

sitemptop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
sitemptop.comment: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice
